title: Bon — Ädelsten
content:
Hi,  
Anyone know which fonts Bon use in their magazine and online?  
Especially interested in the serif one with the words "Ädelsten & Asfalt".

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164057im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Eric-Broms_minimag-poster_5929.jpg)
author: SodaPopinski

comments.content:
This poster: looks like [Austin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164057/http:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/austin) for the serif (/& coming from the italic style) and [Gill Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164057/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/gill-sans/) for the sans  
On website and according to css: [Humanist 521](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164057/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/humanist-521/) (Bitstream version fo Gill Sans), [Adobe Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015164057/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/adobetext/adobetext.html), Lucida Grande, Gill Sans, Times New Roman and Austin

Thanks Ryuk, you seem to be spot on!  
Never thought of Austin looking that good. Uppercase does the trick.  
Thanks!
How do I edit this post with the right font, so it's marked as solved ID?
